thread.title: Lahore Qalandars win toss, bowl first against Islamabad Utd
thread.title_full: Lahore Qalandars win toss, bowl first against Islamabad Utd

title: Lahore Qalandars win toss, bowl first against Islamabad Utd

persons.name: h.e sultan bin jassim al thani

organizations.name: islamabad utd web desk posted    dubai

text:
Web Desk Posted   
DUBAI: Lahore Qalandars won toss and elected to field against Islamabad United in the first match of today in Dubai. 
Defending champions Islamabad United are without   Latif, who have been provisionally suspended over suspected links with an international fixing syndicate. 
Islamabad United pacer Mohammad Irfan is also not playing today's match, captain Misbah informed during toss. Irfan has been questioned by the PCB over suspected contact with the bookies during PSL, but is not facing any immediate suspension, PSL Chairman Najam Sethi tweeted earlier today. 
Sharjeel and Latif were sent back home on Friday after the PCB Anti-Corruption Unit, supported by ICC’s international investigators, found them in violation of the PCB’s Anti-Corruption Code as part of an ongoing investigation into an international syndicate which reportedly contacted a number of players during the ongoing PSL. 
Islamabad United won the opening match of PSL 2017 against Peshawar Zalmi on Thursday by 7 wickets (with 2 balls remaining, according to D/L method). 
Lahore Qalandars lost their first match of this PSL on Friday against Quetta Gladiators. The Qalandars, led by former New Zealand captain Brendon McCullum this time, fell short by 8 runs in a low-scoring thriller. Head to head 
Lahore Qalandars and Islamabad United faced off twice in last year’s season. Both the encounters were won by United – the first by 8 wickets and the second by 5 wickets. In the spotlight 
Brendon McCullum, who has been the most prominent player this season, has a lot of expectations riding on him. He played a quick-fire innings of 20 off 11 deliveries, setting the team on an explosive start along with England opener Jason Roy, but it wasn’t enough to take the team to victory. 
Young Qalandar Mohammad Irfan Jr impressed with his bowling against Quetta Gladiators. He bagged 3 wickets, including crucial wickets of Kevin Pietersen and Rilee Rossouw. 
Islamabad United will be relying on another brilliant batting display by opener Dwayne Smith and wicket-keeper batsman Brad Haddin and the all-round skills of veteran Shane Watson, who proved useful with both the bat and ball in the last match. Squads 
Lahore Qalandars: Brendon McCullum (captain), Sunil Narine, Umar Akmal, Yasir Shah, Sohail Tanvir, Cameron Delport, Mohammad Rizwan, Azhar Ali, Zafar Gohar, Grant Elliot, Fakhar Zaman, Bilawal Bhatti, Ghulam Mudassar, Aamir Yamin, Usman Qadir, Saif Badar, Jason Roy, Chris Green, James Franklin, Muhammad Irfan 
Support staff: Aqib Javed (Director Cricket Operations), Paddy Upton (Coach), Brendon McCullum (Mentor), Shawn Bradstreet (Fielding Coach), Mudassar Nazar (Icon), Fawad Rana (Chairman), Atif Rana (Cheif Executive Officer), Sameen Rana (Cheif Operating Officer), H.E Sultan Bin Jassim Al Thani (Patron In Chief). 
Islamabad United: Misbah Ul Haq, Shane Watson, Mohammad Irfan, Samuel Badree, Mohammad Sami, Brad Haddin, Sam Billings, Hussain Talat, Amad Butt, Dwayne Smith, Zohaib Khan, Ben Duckett, Shadab Khan, Ruman Raees, Saeed Ajmal, Imran Khalid, Asif Ali, Syed Muzammil Shah, Steven Finn 
Support staff: Owner: Leonine Global Sports, Director/Bowling Coach: Wasim Akram, Head Coach: Dean Jones (Australia), Assistant Coach: Tauseef Ahmed, Fielding Coach: Johan Botha (South Africa), Co-Manager: Rehan ul Haq, Co-Manager: Hasan Naeem Related Stories
